Here's your roadmap for the semester! Each day, follow the general process outlined below:

-   Enjoy the notes / text <i class="fas fa-book-open"></i>

-   Attend class, review the <i class="fas fa-pencil-alt"></i> worksheet and solutions if you have any questions after working on it during class.

-   Complete the Lab assignment (<i class="fa-solid fa-code"></i> html & <i class="fa-brands fa-r-project"></i> qmd linked below), <i class="fa-solid fa-paper-plane"></i> submit the assignment before 10am the following class period.

-   Discuss the reflection questions <i class="fas fa-lightbulb"></i> and ethics considerations <i class="fas fa-balance-scale"></i> (see the <a href = "https://st47s.com/SDS261/Notes/" target = "_blank"><i class="fas fa-book-open"></i> class notes</a>) with your classmates and professor.

-   The textbooks are <b> <a href = "https://mdsr-book.github.io/mdsr3e/" target = "_blank">Modern Data Science with R, 3rd edition</a></b> by Baumer, Kaplan, and Horton and <b> <a href = "https://r4ds.hadley.nz/" target = "_blank">R for Data Science, 2nd edition</a></b> by Wickham, Ã‡etinkaya-Rundel, and Grolemund.
